title: For Sale/Trade:  Henry US Survival Rifle (.22lr) in excellent condition
postcontent:
Henry US Survival Rifle (.22lr). 

This is an awesome survival rifle and just fun to shoot.  It fits easily in your backpack or "bug-out" bag and makes a great truck gun.  Everything stores neatly in the stock and it assembles in less than a minute.  Also: When everything is stored in the stock, it floats!!  It’s very light, easy to handle with almost no felt-recoil and that makes it ideal for introducing an adult to shooting or training a youngster.  

This rifle has had only a few rounds through it and it looks as if it was brand new.  Mostly it lived a sheltered existence in my bug-out bag (even though the original shipping box does have a few dings).

IMPORTANT NOTE: This is NOT the original AR-7 or Charter Arms versions of the AR-7 that had many quality control problems in the past.  This is the latest incarnation of that firearm, called the Henry US Survival Rifle, produced by the Henry Repeating Arms Company. The Henry Company bought the production rights from Charter Arms and implemented many problem fixes, tightened quality control and made a few improvements.  Here’s an excerpt from the history of this gun on Wikipedia (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AR-7) .
-------
“In 1980, the design and production rights passed on to Henry Repeating Arms and the compact rifle was slightly revised. The AR-7 is now (2011) known as the Henry U.S. Survival rifle. An ABS material replaced the original plastic, which was prone to cracking and failure. The receiver recess in the Henry stock allows storage of receiver with a magazine in place and the rifle is normally sold with two magazines. The latest versions of the Henry allow for storage of three magazines total, with two in the stock recess, and one in the receiver. The modern Henry U.S. Survival rifle is also waterproof (all prior versions were known to leak water inside the stock). They now include a full teflon coating on the outer surface. A 3/8 in. rail milled into the top of the receiver for mounting a wide variety of optics is now a standard.”
-------
I have added one extra mag to the two that originally shipped with the gun.  All three mags fit neatly in the stock.

This is a takedown model-black, 22lr semi-auto.  It Includes three (10) round factory magazines, in original box as shipped with all paperwork, lock,etc. 

Local sale only please, no shipping (see possible interest in trades below)

title: For Sale:  SIG 9MM
location: Santa Fe, New Mexico, United States
postcontent:
I went kind of crazy at the gun show last weekend. Crazier still this week since I bought yet another gun today. So one needs to go to make room in my bank account to pay for them. I would like cash on this one, though a partial trade might work if you have a Nagant or Tokarev only. 

For some reason, I looked in my gun safe and found I have more 9mm handguns than I will ever use or need. I am really more of an old revolver or antique gun guy. So, here is my SIG 2022 9mm. I only have a couple of boxes of ammo run through it, with zero malfunctions. It is more accurate than I am, and with its polymer frame, recoil feels almost non-existent to me. Google them, and you will see almost universally good reviews. This handgun is about a year old, so it was made after SIG had worked out the few bugs they had when introduced. The trigger is light and predictable. This will come in its original box with a second grip so you can make it fit you. When they come from the factory, the 2022 has a black coating on the barrel which immediately gets scratched when shooting. So I hand polished the breech, which shows through the ejection port, to a 2000 grit gloss. I did not use and power tools or files on it. The result looks pretty good to my eyes. Well actually, really good. There are no scratches or nicks on the gun, and it has never been carried in a holster, so there is no holster wear.

Now that 9mm ammo is becoming available again, I think you will have some fun with this. $14.99 a box at Walmart beats what I have been seeing online by a LOT!

I checked some of the online auctions on these and they seem to be selling at $450-$550 plus shipping and dealer transfer fees. I would like $450 for mine, which is about what I paid for it. I am not a dealer,  so of course, no transfer fee, lol.

Face to face only transactions in this, since if I am going to ship it, I might as well put it on an auction site and get more.

Email me through Armslist with your phone number, and I will call you so we can meet...Thanks for reading my long-winded ad. You will like this SIG. Doby Pilgrim, Santa Fe

title: For Trade:  STOEGER/BERETTA COUGAR .40 S&W, 2 MAGS, LIKE NEW, TRADE ONLY
postcontent: Beretta/Stoeger Cougar, 2 12rd mags, houge grips, night sights, trigger lock, case and 50rds. Made by Stoeger International, a Beretta subsidiary. The Cougar was originally made by Beretta, then later the tooling was moved to the Stoger factory after Beretta bought them out. Chambered in .40 S&W, the Cougar is an accurate and powerful pistol, with emphasis on accurate. I was truly surprised by the accuracy this gun delivers. I own a Sig Sauer P226 9mm, and Im not saying this to push the Cougar, someone will want it either way, but the Cougar is literally twice as accurate and reliable. Its never jammed, and never strayed a shot more than a few inches from dead center at nearly any range. Im not desperate to move this thing, so don't offer me Kel-Tec's or Jennings 58's. This is a quality pistol, even if the MSRP isn't a thousand dollars. Don't let this one get away from you, you would never even know what you missed out on.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Armalite M15A2 Stainless National Match
postcontent:
I have a complete Armalite M15A2 National Match upper available for sale or trade.
Look up the retail price of the full rifle, it's $1,375-$1,425 depending where you look.

I had the barrel cut to 18" and threaded 1/2-28 (standard thread pattern) to accept a flash hider or suppressor.
I bought an Armalite flat top upper to replace the standard fixed carry handle upper, and installed a Magpul MOe hand guard. It does have a rifle length gas system, and comes with an A2 fixed front sight/gas block..

The picture of the target shows my shot group at 100 yards with cheap 55 grain pmc brass, I was using a Nikon m-223 scope on a Burris P.E.P.R. Mount.

~350 rounds have been through it, and it's amazingly accurate with the right shooter.
Feet free to call/text anytime at REDACTED. $950 takes it all, text me, and we'll talk

THIS AMMO IS BETTER THAN CCI MINIMAGS!

22LR Aguila .22 Interceptor--Copper Plater--Hollow Points--1470fps

Bullet details....40-grain copper plated lead round nose bullet. Screaming hot and hard-hitting! Gives 1470 fps with a 40 grain bullet. Normal High Velocity 22LR ammo goes about 1250 fps with a 40 gr bullet. "Hyper Velocity" ammo uses a lighter bullet to go even faster: (For example, the hyper velocity CCI Stinger uses a 32 gr bullet and goes 1640 fps.) So, the Aguila Interceptor delivers the hard impact of the heavier 40 grain bullet at a velocity almost as high as Stinger--an excellent combination of knock down and trajectory. 5% more energy than CCI Velocitor at the same bullet weight and the same energy as CCI Stinger with a 25% heavier bullet! title: For Sale:  Selling a gun? I can photograph it in Hd!
postcontent:
Why use a low resolution cell phone picture or other low end camera to represent an item you'd like to sell. Lots of research shows that a better picture has higher chances of selling an item.

For a very reasonable fee, I can use my high end professional camera to photograph your item as you'd like it done. Image editing included to really make the picture stand out. 

If you're selling an old VCR, a cell phone might work. When you intend to represent a near thousand dollar item in an attractive and detailed manner, my opinion is that the picture SHOULD do it justice.

I am not a professional photographer... I bought a nice camera for a hobby and I also enjoy firearms... This is a fun and interesting blend of the two, at a much lower cost than a professional studio.


I charge $20 for up to 30 mins and $25 for a 30-45 min session, with editing included afterwards until you are satisfied. 

NOTE: For safety reasons, I require a copy of your valid FOID and matching Illinois ID before we meet, and I will provide the same.

Whether you intend to use it on armslist or elsewhere, high quality photographs are a must for any serious seller.

title: For Sale:  Eagle Arms Open bolt 45acp
postcontent: This is an extremely rare, 100% legal open bolt carbine.  Developed and manufactured in small numbers from 1964-68, patterned around the M3 Grease Gun and used genuine Thompson 1928 wood stocks in their construction. Made by the Eagle Gun Company, which operated out of Stratford, Connecticut.  The Eagle Mark I, followed later by the Mark II version, were the first of several open bolt carbines to be manufactured and sold in the 1960's. These were followed by the Spitfire, the Apache and the Commando Carbine which appeared in the early 1970's. All were semiauto carbines that fired either .45 ACP or 9mm pistol cartridges using surplus Thompson, M3 or Sten magazines. The Spitfire's and Apache's were later banned by the ATF and reclassified as "machine guns", in effect making the already rare Eagle Carbine one of the only legal versions of this type of firearm.  This is a very early one, under 100 serial number, in great condition and fun to shoot. Comes with two mags.   I would hang on to it if I could, but must sacrifice to fund other toys. Price includes shipping to your FFL.

title: For Sale:  Sig Sauer P250 Compact 9mm
location: Rockaway Area, New Jersey, United States
postcontent:
This is the newer style P250C in 9mm with Nitron slide.  It has approximately 600 rounds through it.  I am the second owner.

This gun has Sig night sights and comes with the original case, lock, manual, etc.  It will come with (2) 15 round mags.  These are factory Sig mags. I have 3 more 15 rounders and two 10 rounders that can be included for additional cost.  

The gun came with a plastic guide rod and captured flat recoil spring.  I have had no issue with it, but I obtained a steel guide rod and braided spring just in case.  I have not used it, but it will be included with the pistol.  I will aslo include a Fobus paddle holster.

The P250 is a great gun for NJ.  You can very easily change slide, barrel and grip to .45ACP, .40 S&W or .357SIG without worrying about new permits.  Same goes for size.  Full size, compact, sub-compact, all using the same fire control unit.  These guns have one of the best DAO triggers you will ever shoot. 

I have another, and with the modularity I don't really need 2.  I don't even rememebr the last time I shot this one, so ti might as well find a new home where it will get some use.  MSRP new is $642 with the night sights and a single magazine. This one is $450 with the extras.  More pictures available on request.

Buyer must have all appropriate paperwork.
